result.execSummary:
The defendant Nathan S. Albright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Cash Bond to be applied; balance to be returned to poster.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nathan S. Albright

defendant.name: Albright, Nathan S.
defendant.address: 1355 Lois Avenue, c/o Ms. Nicole Baird, Brookfield, WI 53045

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend the charge to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended charge.  Atty Gumz agrees.  Defendant agrees.
BY THE COURT:  Charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, 947.01(1)

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended charge.

  State has complied with victim notification requirements.
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Court orders 55 days in the Marquette County Jail
Credit = 44 days
Time Served
Court Costs = $243.00
DNA Sample + $200 Surcharge

Cash bond to be applied; balance to be returned to the party that posted it.

ADDRESS INFO for Nathan S. Albright
Current: 1355 Lois Avenue, c/o Ms. Nicole Baird, Brookfield, WI 53045 United States  (Effective: 10-13-2016)
Prior: W4138 Elk Ave, Montello, WI 53949

**Amended Conditions by the Court to remove the no contact:
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  *No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

Attorney Mark Jay Gumz in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Back on the record:
Atty Hendee states that one of the conditions of bond was no contact with his grandparents; the grandparents have contacted the DA's office to lift the no contact.  Atty Hendee is open to waiving the no contact provision and asks the court to remove that condition.

BY THE COURT:  Bond will be amended to remove the no contact with M.A. or A. A. based on the request.
Defendant is to sign the new bond today.

Final pre-trial on October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.
*No contact with A.A. or M.A.  *Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance  *No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that there has been several discussions on possible settlement with Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz has filed a motion to modify the bond.  Atty Gumz states that the matter is not resolved and enters a Not Guilty plea and asks the court to set a jury trial.  Atty Gumz asks for modification of the cash bail due to the stolen property being found per the defendant's family.
Court questions Atty Gumz.  Atty Gumz responds and asks for $500 - $600 cash bond to be set.  Atty Hendee responds and agrees with the money being found but the jewelry was not.

BY THE COURT:  Set for Jury Trial
Court will modify the cash bond to a $500 cash bond with the same conditions.
  Jury trial scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Statement of Compliance
Signed by Carol I. Jaksic
Victim Witness Coordinator
Return date on August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Nathan S. Albright in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Defendant Nathan S. Albright in custody.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court confirms the defendant's address. Atty Gumz states that the defendant is in the Marquette County Jail at this time.   Atty Gumz states that the Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Atty Gumz enters a Not Guilty plea.  Court finds probable cause to support the charges.

BY THE COURT: Not Guilty plea entered.
Set for Return.
bond continued.

Atty Gumz makes bail modification arguments and asks the court to modify to a $500 cash bail.
Atty Hendee responds and asks the court to deny the motion.
BY THE COURT:  Bond modification request is denied; bond will be continued.
  Return date scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
